intro: Mezzettia, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wet meadows and marshy areas. Mezzettia is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland ecosystems.
